Description: Upper body sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with band in added red near bottom of sherd; exterior: glaze dot at top of sherd and two lines at bottom; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 30(b) (or possibly 36) is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1809) (phase 2)
